newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-MALONE LEADS JAZZ TO VICTORY, TRAIL CHICAGO 2-1 IN FINALS.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-MALONE LEADS JAZZ TO VICTORY, TRAIL CHICAGO 2-1 IN FINALS.

text.p: The Mailman delivered early then survived a late run by the Bulls as Karl Malone led Utah to a big lead and the Jazz held on to beat Chicago 104-93 Friday and gain a foothold in the NBA Finals.

The NBA's Most Valuable Player, performing at home after two defeats in Chicago and taunts of "MVP" every time Bulls favourite Michael Jordan was in the spotlight, scored 37 points and got 10 rebounds, three assists and four steals.

He also got some help off the bench from Greg Foster, who had 17 points, and his longtime running mate John Stockton, who after a subpar first three quarters wound up with 17 points -- including Utah's last six, lead-preserving points on free throws -- and dished out 12 assists.

Scottie Pippen had 27 points and Michael Jordan 26 as Chicago, which trailed by as many as 24 points, began stealing the ball and hitting 3-pointers to come as close as five points at 100-95 with just over a half-minute to go.
But Stockton's pressure-charged free throws at the end held off the Bulls, who now lead the best-of-seven series two games to one.
Games 4 and 5 will also be in Salt Lake City before returning to Chicago, if necessary.
The Jazz still have not lost at home in these playoffs and have been defeated only once at the Delta Centre since the All-Star break, winning 22 in a row.
The Bulls, who came in 3-0 in Finals Game 3's on the road, have never swept the championship series. They have also never lost a Finals in four previous appearances.
